body.p: A plugin is a software component that adds extra functionality to the standalone version of the application using a series of application-provided extension points.

This chapter explains how to write and install a plugin for the standalone version of . The Plugins Development Kit contains sample plugins (source and compiled Java code) and the Javadoc API necessary for developing custom plugins.
If you want to customize the Eclipse plugin you can look at the Eclipse IDE Integration Sample Project to see how an Eclipse plugin can interact with the APIs.
